alert.note: Alert for Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 6:26PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hidalgo County through 700 PM CDT... At 626 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Mccook, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mission, Palmview, Palmhurst, Sharyland, Alton, Narciso G. Cavazos Elementary School, Mission Fire Station Number 3, Abram-Perezville, Cesar Chavez Middle School and Doffing. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 848 and 850. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
